decisions.decision: Use MCP (Model Context Protocol) as the system standard
decisions.rationale: Less informational fog, purpose-built for agents, aligns with algebraic vision

strategic_priority.principle: Goldratt's Theory of Constraints - THE GOAL is money for the enterprise
strategic_priority.directive: Fastest path to revenue. Not things, not wealth accumulation - CASH FLOW for operations.
strategic_priority.rationale: Create tools developers embed in THEIR apps. One customer = millions of end users. Leverage, lock-in, usage-based revenue.
strategic_priority.constraint_focus: Identify and exploit the bottleneck. Everything else is subordinate.

first_customer_principle.rule: Tiny amount, tiny effort = best way to start
first_customer_principle.mantra: Don't wait for the big deal. Get a TINY deal. As fast as possible.
first_customer_principle.milestone: FIRST PAYING CUSTOMER. The first one. That's the target.
first_customer_principle.why: Proof of value. Proof of market. Momentum. Everything else is theory until someone pays.

monetization_concept.name: Office Expansion Packs
monetization_concept.core_idea: Sell SPINUPS not compute. User buys an 'intern' for $1.99, which grants them an additional parallel instance of that agent type.
monetization_concept.ux_framing: Your office just expanded! Hanna now has a creative assistant.
monetization_concept.user_perception: They bought a 'person' — their virtual team grew
monetization_concept.technical_reality: They purchased permission to spawn +1 concurrent LLM instance for that agent
why_this_works: Scalable = user buys as they need

core_psychology.thesis: PAYING for your office build is MORE satisfying than getting it free
core_psychology.prediction: Users will BUY more than they would USE if free
principles: IKEA Effect - people value what they invest in building
Sunk Cost Engagement - payment creates commitment to use
Collecting Psychology - buying team = collectible dopamine
Free = Disposable - zero cost = zero identity attachment
core_psychology.system_philosophy: Microtransaction the ENTIRE system. Every expansion is a purchase.

the_scale.danger: Gamification must NOT minimize the actual power of the system
the_scale.balance: Unknown - this is the proportion we must find to win

design_tension.guiding_question: Does this purchase make the user MORE powerful, or just feel like they paid for nothing?
success_criteria: Free tier is still genuinely useful (not crippled)
Paid users feel powerful, not nickel-and-dimed
The game IS the work, the work IS the game

immediate_questions: What is the ONE constraint blocking revenue RIGHT NOW?
What is the minimum viable product developers will PAY for?
Who are the first 10 paying customers?
What can we ship THIS WEEK that generates revenue?

deferred_repairs.description: Holes we plugged fast - proper fix needed later. Constraint mindset: don't let perfect block revenue.

items.hole: React frontend not wired to backend agents
items.quick_plug: Skip frontend for now, test via CLI
items.proper_fix: Wire ChatPage.jsx to backend orchestrator via API

items.hole: Bus architecture defined but not running
items.quick_plug: Direct function calls between agents for demo
items.proper_fix: Implement full event-driven dispatch with Mei sleep/wake

items.hole: Intern system works but not production-hardened
items.proper_fix: Error handling, retry logic, rate limiting, cost tracking

design_considerations.task: What happens if a request matches multiple agents?
Does the algebraic router handle decomposition?
design_considerations.notes: Or must the user phrase clearly?

design_considerations.task: Once invoked, can agents invoke interns freely?

product_tiers.name: DeepFish Starter
target_market: Gamers who want to create, not just consume
product_tiers.positioning: Making your own app is better than using someone else's

product_tiers.name: DeepFish Pro
target_market: People who recognize excellence and pay for it
product_tiers.llm_strategy: Highest-scoring LLMs, most expensive token chains, no compromises
